page.title: 10BOURTON-ON-DUNSMORE
page.content: {BOURTON CHURCH}WAS BUILT IN THE THIRTEENTH CENTURY. THE OLDEST GRAVESTONE IN THE GRAVEYARD HAS BEEN THERE SINCE{1683.}ABOUT THIRTY TO FOURTY PEOPLE GO TO BOURTON CHURCH BUT SOMETIMES MORE. THE CHURCH ALWAYS HAS A SMALL SUMMER FETE IN JULY, BUT IN ALTERNATE YEARS THERE IS A{BIG FETE, HELD IN PARTNERSHIP WITH FRANKTON. THE OLD{BOURTON SCHOOL}WAS CLOSED IN 1975 THE CHILDREN THEN HAD TO TRAVEL TO STRETTON SCHOOL BY COACH. THERE IS A CLUB CALLED THE WORKING MENS CLUB WHICH IS A SOCIAL CLUB WHERE PEOPLE MEET AND HAVE A DRINK. ON A SATURDAY NIGHT THERE IS A BINGO CLUB THERE,AND ON SUNDAY A SPECIAL RAFFLE IS HELD. IN THE VILLAGE THERE IS ALSO A WAR MEMORIAL WITH THE NAMES OF THE PEOPLE WHO DIED IN THE TWO WORLD WARS.
